Red Sox sign outfielder Victorino to 3-year deal

Free agent outfielder Shane Victorino has agreed to a $38 million contract with the Red Sox, the Globe has confirmed. The deal is pending a physical. (Boston Globe)

Reebok cuts 65 jobs at Canton site

The layoffs come after Reebok’s parent company, Adidas AG, slashed its long-term sales forecast at Reebok from about $3.9 billion in 2015 to $2.6 billion. (Boston Globe)

A life saved and lived well

When it ended after 92 years, Bob Muse’s life was a sweeping epic, but he would have told you his greatest accomplishment was getting an innocent man out of prison.

Headhunters are struggling to find enough talented engineers and developers for their Boston-area clients.

Bank of America to cut more jobs

Bank of America Corp., which is in the process of streamlining operations around the US, plans to eliminate nearly 200 jobs at two Mass. facilities next year.

Cambridge Community Television, which is approaching its 25th anniversary, has become known for a series featuring outspoken residents.

Business

Investor Icahn ends bid for truck maker Oshkosh

Icahn withdrew his bid after less than 25 percent of the company's shares were tendered before his offer expired, and OshKosh Corp. stock fell 5 percent in early trading.
